item.title: MiniMax's new open M2.5 and M2.5 Lightning near state-of-the-art while costing 1/20th of Claude Opus 4.6
item.description: Chinese AI startup MiniMax, headquartered in Shanghai, has sent shockwaves through the AI industry today with the release of its new M2.5 language model in two variants, which promises to make high-end artificial intelligence so cheap you might stop worrying about the bill entirely. It's also said to be "open source," though the weights (settings) and code haven't been posted yet, nor has the exact license type or terms. But that's almost beside the point given how cheap MiniMax is serving it through its API and those of partners.For the last few years, using the world’s most powerful AI was l...

item.title: World's largest monitor company designed a 4K 48-inch OLED dual-sided smart gaming display with metal feet, a magnetic power socket, and an Alienware-inspired sound system - but who will actually use it?
item.description: GP TV introduces dual-sided 4K OLED display combining gaming design, immersive audio, safety features, and uncertain real-world practicality.

item.title: Anthropic raises another $30B in Series G, with a new value of $380B
item.description: The infusion of funding for the AI startup takes place as it is vying for customers and cultural attention with its competitor, OpenAI.

item.title: YouTube finally launches a dedicated app for Apple Vision Pro
item.description: When Apple Vision Pro first came out two years ago, YouTube hesitated to release a dedicated app. Today is the day they officially launch one.

item.title: The best wireless earbuds for 2026
item.description: Wireless earbuds are now the default option for everyday listening, whether you’re heading out for a commute, fitting in a workout or just watching videos at home. The best wireless earbuds combine reliable connectivity, comfortable fits and sound quality that holds up across music, calls and podcasts, all without the hassle of cables. Most are small enough to disappear into a pocket and pair quickly with phones, tablets and laptops.What sets one pair apart from another often comes down to priorities. Some earbuds lean heavily on active noise cancellation, while others focus on long battery li...

item.title: ‘Starfleet Academy’ Decides Everyone Needs a Harsh Lesson
item.description: 'Come, Let's Away' brings 'Starfleet Academy' back to a more classically 'Star Trek' place, leveraging its young heroes in a compelling way.

item.title: Waymo Asks the DC Public to Pressure Their City Officials
item.description: Stuck in regulatory limbo, the self-driving-vehicle developer is encouraging residents of Washington, DC, to message public officials to help get its robotaxis onto roads.

item.title: Cette comète va bientôt frôler le Soleil et pourrait devenir visible en plein jour
item.description: La comète C/2026 A1 devrait passer près du Soleil début avril et pourrait être détruite à cette occasion. Ce qui sera surtout l'opportunité de mener de nombreuses observations astronomiques sur un phénomène rarement vu par les télescopes.

item.title: A Wave of Unexplained Bot Traffic Is Sweeping the Web
item.description: From small publishers to US federal agencies, websites are reporting unusual spikes in automated traffic linked to IP addresses in Lanzhou, China.

item.title: These digital tools are stepping up the global fight against wildlife trafficking
item.description: No single technology will end wildlife trafficking, but these digital tools can enable a shift. In late 2025, Interpol coordinated a global operation across 134 nations, seizing roughly 30,000 live animals, confiscating illegal plant and timber products, and identifying about 1,100 suspected wildlife traffickers for national police to investigate.

item.title: 27 beautiful beige-inspired home office finds for creating your calming, neutral workspace
item.description: From champagne beige to stone oat, this is the office furniture, desk accessories, and essential gadgets and decor to create the right vibe.

item.title: Estée Lauder tested products sold on Walmart’s site. What it found led to a lawsuit
item.description: The beauty giant alleges Walmart sold counterfeit skincare and fragrances online, including products from La Mer and Tom Ford. Estée Lauder has accused Walmart of selling counterfeit beauty goods on its website in a lawsuit filed in California federal court earlier this week that namechecks celebrities including Taylor Swift and Beyoncé.

item.title: How to watch Hull City vs. Chelsea online for free
item.description: How to watch FA Cup for free. Live stream Hull City vs. Chelsea in the FA Cup for free from anywhere in the world.

item.title: EU reportedly opens another probe into Google's ads pricing
item.description: The European Commission has opened a new probe into Google, this time focused on the company's massive online advertising business, Bloomberg reports. European Union regulators have already fined Google billions for violating the Digital Markets Act, and being found guilty of anticompetitive behavior in online advertising could add to that total.While the Commission has yet to announce a formal investigation, Bloomberg writes that it has started contacting Google's customers and competitors for information about its dominance across multiple online advertising markets. Regulators are particula...

item.title: Romance scam red flags to look out for
item.description: Romance cons are on the rise online, especially due to AI. Here are tips to avoid them.

item.title: In one swoop, Trump kills US greenhouse gas regulations
item.description: The Trump administration just eliminated the landmark finding that has underpinned federal regulations on planet-heating pollution since 2009. For nearly the past two decades, the "endangerment finding" has allowed the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to craft rules limiting greenhouse gas emissions under the Clean Air Act. Rather than repealing those rules individually, the Trump administration […]...

item.title: Own a Chrysler, Dodge, Jeep, or Ram? You may be under a stop-drive warning
item.description: Stellantis has issued a stop-drive warning for 225,000 vehicles due to a dangerous Takata airbag defect. Stellantis, the maker of Chrysler, Dodge, Jeep, Ram, issued a “do not drive” warning for certain late-model vehicles, telling drivers not to use their vehicles until defective air bags are replaced, according to a notice from the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA)....

item.title: Antitrust head overseeing Netflix-Warner merger resigns
item.description: The head of the antitrust division is out at the US Department of Justice. Gail Slater, a former JD Vance adviser and Fox Corp VP, reportedly clashed with Attorney General Pam Bondi. Their longstanding feud is said to have centered around Slater's skepticism of corporate mergers."It is with great sadness and abiding hope that I leave my role as [Assistant Attorney General] for Antitrust today," Slater posted on X. "It was indeed the honor of a lifetime to serve in this role."Although Slater technically resigned, The Guardian reports that she was forced out. The fallout was said to be over her ...

item.title: Hacker linked to Epstein removed from Black Hat cyber conference website
item.description: Emails published by the Justice Department revealed cybersecurity veteran Vincenzo Iozzo emailed, and arranged to meet, Jeffrey Epstein multiple times between 2014 and 2018.

item.title: Trump administration undermines EPA enforcement of Clean Air Act
item.description: The EPA's new rule seeks to undo a 2009 finding that allowed the federal government to regulate six greenhouse gases.

item.title: In defense of wasting time
item.description: Why the least efficient forms of thinking may be the most valuable in the age of AI For most of modern management history, wasting time has been treated as a vice. This sensibility can be traced back to Frederick Taylor’s doctrine of scientific management, which recast work as an engineering problem and workers as components in a machine to be optimized, standardized, and controlled. In reducing human effort to measurable outputs and time-motion efficiencies, Taylorism marked the beginning of the end for seeing people as thinking agents, turning them instead into productivity units not unlike ...

item.title: Two powerful, OLED-equipped gaming laptops are hundreds off

item.description: Squanch Games CEO Mike Fridley has said releasing High on Life 2 simultaneously on Xbox and PlayStation was a "no-brainer" following the first game's long Xbox exclusivity window.

item.title: Trump Just Blew American Climate Policy to Smithereens
item.description: President Trump and EPA Administrator Lee Zeldin announced the repeal of the endangerment finding, the legal bedrock for the agency's actions against planet-warming pollution.

item.title: Eufy’s midrange X10 Pro Omni robovac has fallen to its best-ever price
item.description: Spring doesn’t officially kick off until March 20th, but there’s something to be said about getting a head start on your spring cleaning. Lucky for you, Eufy’s X10 Pro Omni is currently on sale at Amazon, Walmart, and directly from Eufy (with promo code WS7DV2D5LF9F) for $449.99 ($450 off), matching its lowest price to date. […]

item.title: Why tech helps Minneapolis more than it helps ICE
item.description: In challenging ICE, Minneapolis has mastered signal voice chats, free 3-D printed whistles, and electronic billboards.
